title: Compost Bin

properties.value: A compost bin is an immovable container where weeds, crops, herbs, fruits, and other Farming produce are placed to make compost, supercompost, ultracompost, or rotten tomatoes. Compost bins are located next to allotment/flower/herb patches. Noted items cannot be added to the compost bin.

The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Compost Bin
This article is about regular compost bins. For the big compost bin found in the Farming Guild, see Big Compost Bin.
Compost Bin

A compost bin is an immovable container where weeds, crops, herbs, fruits, and other Farming produce are placed to make compost, supercompost, ultracompost, or rotten tomatoes. Compost bins are located next to allotment/flower/herb patches. Noted items cannot be added to the compost bin.

Contents

  • 1 Locations
  • 2 Mechanics
  • 3 Products of rotting
    • 3.1 Suitable items for supercompost
  • 4 Changes

Locations[edit | edit source]

  • South of Falador (Explorer's ring 2-4)
  • West of Port Phasmatys (Ectophial teleport)
  • North of Ardougne (Ardougne cloak 2-4)
  • North of Catherby (Camelot Teleport/Catherby Teleport)
  • South-west of Hosidius (Xeric's talisman glade teleport or Tithe Farm Minigame teleport)
  • Farming Guild beginners wing (Skills necklace) - This is a Big Compost Bin, which can hold double the amount of compostable items, and thus double the amount of compost.
  • North-east Prifddinas (Spirit Tree or eternal teleport crystal)

Mechanics[edit | edit source]

Players need 15 items to fill the compost bin (or 30 if filling the big compost bin in the farming guild), which they can then close to start the rotting process.

Players must use 15 supercompost-compatible items in the compost bin to make supercompost - even one incompatible item will make the whole contents into regular compost. This is the same when making rotten tomatoes. A message will pop up warning the player if they attempt to add something that would impurify their compost bin. Alternatively, players can use one dose of compost potion on a bin containing normal compost to change the entire bin into supercompost.

25 (or 50) volcanic ash can be used on a full compost bin containing supercompost in order to upgrade it to ultracompost.

It is advisable to make entire bins into higher tiers of compost, as using it on buckets costs more in total — one compost potion turns one bucket of compost into supercompost, or one bin of 15 compost into 15 supercompost, and 30 volcanic ash turns 15 buckets of supercompost into ultracompost (2 ash per bucket), or 25 ash turns one bin of 15 supercompost into 15 ultracompost, saving 5 ash.

Compost takes about 35 to 50 minutes to decompose inside the bin. Once it is finished, players can open the bin and collect the resulting 15 (or 30) compost using buckets. Empty buckets in the player's inventory will be filled first, followed by their Bottomless compost bucket.

Products of rotting[edit | edit source]

  • Compost, made by rotting weeds and low level farming products.
  • Supercompost, made by rotting high level farming products (see below). Using a compost potion on a bin of regular compost will also turn it into supercompost.
    • Ultracompost, made by using 25 volcanic ash on a bin of supercompost.
  • Rotten tomatoes, made by rotting 15 tomatoes.

Suitable items for supercompost[edit | edit source]

Players may use an item on a farmer to check whether the item will make compost or supercompost. The following items will always make supercompost.

  • Watermelons (grow on adjacent allotment and put directly in bin)
  • Snape grass (grow on adjacent allotment and put directly in bin)
  • Pineapples
    • Pick in Brimhaven
    • Buy from charter ship shops in Catherby or elsewhere for a few coins each
    • Buy in the Grand Tree Groceries shop
    • Grow them from pineapple plants
  • Calquat fruit (a cheap supercompostable item)
  • Bittercap mushrooms (grow in mushroom patch west of Canifis)
  • Tree roots (obtained when a tree is dug up from a tree patch)
  • Coconut shells (use the empty coconut shell, which is otherwise useless)
  • Papaya fruit
  • Jangerberries (respawn on ogre island, west of Yanille; not recommended as they are expensive)
  • White berries (not recommended as they are expensive)
  • Poison ivy berries
  • Herbs, excluding guam leaf, rogue's purse, snake weed, tarromin, marrentill, harralander, and ranarr weed.
  • White tree fruit (after Garden of Tranquillity)

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
12 August 2020
(update)

Composting snape grass will now get you supercompost instead of the regular stuff.

28 May 2015
(update)

When examining compost bins, depending on whether the contents of the compost bin is rotting, has finished rotting, items are being put in or items are being taken out, the examine message will change to describe the state of the bin and what is inside it.

1 May 2014
(update)

Adding items into a compost bin has been sped up.

23 May 2013
(update | poll)

If you put something into a compost bin, you will now automatically continue putting those items into the bin until you run out or the bin becomes full.

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

A '''compost bin''' is an immovable container where [[weeds]], crops, [[herb]]s, fruits, and other [[Farming]] produce are placed to make [[compost]], [[supercompost]], [[ultracompost]], or [[rotten tomato]]es. Compost bins are located next to [[Farming/Patch locations|allotment/flower/herb patches]]. Noted items cannot be added to the compost bin.

==Locations==
*South of [[Falador]] ([[Explorer's ring 2]]-[[Explorer's ring 4|4]])
*West of [[Port Phasmatys]] ([[Ectophial]] teleport)
*North of [[East Ardougne|Ardougne]] ([[Ardougne cloak 2]]-[[Ardougne cloak 4|4]])
*North of [[Catherby]] ([[Camelot Teleport]]/[[Catherby Teleport]])
*South-west of [[Hosidius]] ([[Xeric's talisman]] glade teleport or Tithe Farm Minigame teleport)
*[[Farming Guild]] beginners wing ([[Skills necklace]]) - This is a [[Big Compost Bin]], which can hold double the amount of compostable items, and thus double the amount of compost.
*North-east [[Prifddinas]] ([[Spirit Tree]] or [[eternal teleport crystal|eternal]] [[teleport crystal]])

==Mechanics==
Players need 15 items to fill the compost bin (or 30 if filling the big compost bin in the farming guild), which they can then close to start the rotting process.

Players must use 15 supercompost-compatible items in the compost bin to make supercompost - even one incompatible item will make the whole contents into regular compost. This is the same when making rotten tomatoes. A message will pop up warning the player if they attempt to add something that would impurify their compost bin. Alternatively, players can use one dose of [[compost potion]] on a bin containing normal compost to change the entire bin into supercompost.

25 (or 50) [[volcanic ash]] can be used on a full compost bin containing supercompost in order to upgrade it to ultracompost.

It is advisable to make entire bins into higher tiers of compost, as using it on buckets costs more in total — one compost potion turns one bucket of compost into supercompost, or one bin of 15 compost into 15 supercompost, and 30 volcanic ash turns 15 buckets of supercompost into ultracompost (2 ash per bucket), or 25 ash turns one bin of 15 supercompost into 15 ultracompost, saving 5 ash.

Compost takes about 35 to 50 minutes to decompose inside the bin. Once it is finished, players can open the bin and collect the resulting 15 (or 30) compost using [[bucket]]s. Empty buckets in the player's inventory will be filled first, followed by their [[Bottomless compost bucket]].

==Products of rotting==
*[[Compost]], made by rotting [[weeds]] and low level farming products.
*[[Supercompost]], made by rotting high level farming products (see below). Using a compost potion on a bin of regular compost will also turn it into supercompost.
**[[Ultracompost]], made by using 25 [[volcanic ash]] on a bin of supercompost.
*[[Rotten tomato]]es, made by rotting 15 [[tomato]]es.

===Suitable items for supercompost===
Players may use an item on a [[Group of Advanced Gardeners|farmer]] to check whether the item will make compost or supercompost. The following items will always make supercompost.
*[[Watermelon]]s (grow on adjacent allotment and put directly in bin)
*[[Snape grass]] (grow on adjacent allotment and put directly in bin)
*[[Pineapple]]s
**Pick in [[Brimhaven]]
**Buy from [[Trader Crewmember|charter ship shops]] in [[Catherby]] or elsewhere for a few coins each
**Buy in the [[Grand Tree Groceries]] shop
**Grow them from [[pineapple plant]]s
*[[Calquat fruit]] (a cheap supercompostable item)
*[[Mushroom|Bittercap mushrooms]] (grow in mushroom patch west of [[Canifis]])
*[[Tree roots]] (obtained when a tree is dug up from a tree patch)
*[[Coconut shell]]s (use the empty coconut shell, which is otherwise useless)
*[[Papaya fruit]]
*[[Jangerberries]] (respawn on ogre island, west of [[Yanille]]; not recommended as they are expensive)
*[[White berries]] (not recommended as they are expensive)
*[[Poison ivy berries]]
*[[Herb]]s, excluding [[guam leaf]], [[rogue's purse]], [[snake weed]], [[tarromin]], [[marrentill]], [[harralander]], and [[ranarr weed]].
*[[White tree fruit]] (after [[Garden of Tranquillity]])

==Changes==
